tuv.seg: The Mental Health Commission is an independent body established under the Mental Health Act 2001
Is comhlacht neamhspleách é an Coimisiún Meabhair-Shláinte a bunaíodh faoin Acht Meabhair-Shlláinte 2001

The Commission's functions are to promote, encourage and foster high standards and good practices in the delivery of mental health services and to protect the interests of people who are detained in approved psychiatric centres

Is é príomh chuspóir an Choimisiúin ná caighdeáin arda agus deá-chleachtas seirbhísí sláinte mheabhrach á gcur ar fáil a chur chun cinn gus a chothabháil agus chun leas na ndaoine atá faoi choinneáil in aonaid shíciatracha ceadaithe, a chosaint
The Commission has a number of responsibilities under the Act that include:
Tá roinnt freagrachtaí ag an gCoimisiún faoin Acht lena n-áirítear:
• Appointing people to mental health tribunals to review the detention of involuntary patients and appointing a legal representative for each patient
• Daoine a cheapadh chuig binsí meabhair-shláinte chun athbhreithniú a dhéanamh ar choinneáil othar neamhdheonacha agus chun ionadaí dlí a cheapadh i leith gach othair
• Establishing and maintaining a Register of Approved Centres that are inpatient facilities providing care and treatment for people with a mental illness and mental disorder

• Clár de na hIonaid Síciatracha Cheadaithe a bhunú agus a chothabháil ar saoráidí d’othair chónaithe iad a sholáthraíonn cúram agus cóireáil do dhaoine a bhfuil meabhairghalar nó neamhord meabhrach ag dul dóibh
• Making rules regulating the use of specific treatments and interventions such as ECT (Electroconvulsive Therapy), seclusion and mechanical restraint
• Rialacha a dhéanamh a rialáil ar úsáid cóireálacha agus idirghábhacha ar leith mar ECT (teiripe leictri-thritheamhach), leithlis agus srianadh meicniúil
• Developing codes of practice for people working in the mental health services and enable them to provide high quality care and treatment to service users
• Cód cleachtais a fhorbairt do dhaoine atá ag obair sna seirbhísí meabhair-shláinte agus cur ar a gcumas cúram agus cóireáil ar ardchaighdeán a chur ar fáil d’úsáideoirí seirbhísí
• Appointing the Inspector of Mental Health Services who inspects approved psychiatric centres annually
• Cigire na Seirbhísí Meabhair-Shláinte a cheapadh a dhéanann cigireacht ar ionaid síciatracha cheadaithe gach bliain
The Commission has 13 members
Tá 13 ball ar an gCoimisiún
As required by the Mental Health Act 2001, members include:
De réir forálacha an Acht Meabhair-Shláinte 2001, áiritear i measc na mball seo:
• Three registered practitioners of whom 2 are consultant psychiatrists
• Trí chleachtóir cláraithe ina n-áiritear beirt mar shíciatraíthe comhairleacha
• A Health Service Executive (HSE) employee nominated by the HSE
• Fostaí on bhFeidhmeannacht na Seirbhíse Sláinte
• A representative of the general public and
• Ionadaí ón bpobal i gcoitinne agus
• Three representatives of voluntary bodies (at least 2 of whom must have or have had a mental illness)
• Trí ionadaí ó chomhlachtaí deonacha (caithfidh beirt acu ar a laghad meabhairghalar a bheith orthu nó go raibh meabhairghalar ag dul dóibh)
You can read this guide to the Mental Health Commission (pdf)
Féadfaidh tú an treoir chuig an gCoimisiún Meabhair-Shláinte (pdf) a léamh

The Mental Health Commission appoints mental health tribunals to automatically review all decisions to involuntarily detain patients or to extend the duration of such detentions under the provisions of the Mental Health Act, 2001. A mental health tribunal is a group of 3 people who review a person’s involuntary admission

Ceapfaidh an Coimisiún Meabhair-Shláinte binsí meabhair-shláinte chun athbhreithniú uathoibreach a dhéanamh ar gach cinneadh chun othair a choinneáil go neamhdheonach nó chun síneadh ama a chuir leis an gcoinneáil faoi fhorálacha an Acht Meabhair-Shláinte 2001
When the Mental Health Commission receives a copy of an admission or renewal order, it must:
Nuair a gheobhaidh an Coimisiún Meabhair-Shláinte cóip de ordú iontrála nó athnuachana, caithfidh sé:
• Refer the matter to a mental health tribunal
• An cás a chuir faoi bhráid an bhinse meabhair-shláinte
• Assign a legal representative to represent the patient unless the patient personally engages one
• Ionadaí dlíthiúil a shannadh chun feidhmiú ar son an othair, muna mbíonn ceann fostaithe ag an othar go pearsanta

• Arrange for a consultant psychiatrist to examine the patient; interview the consultant psychiatrist responsible for the patient's treatment and care; and review the patient's records in order to decide, in the interests of the patient, whether the patient is suffering from a mental disorder

• Stiúradh a thabhairt i scríbhinn do bhall den phainéal síciatraithe comhairleacha an t-othar a scrúdú; agallamh a chur ar an síciatrach comhairleach a bhí freagrach as cóireáil agus cúram an othair; agus athbhreithniú a dhéanamh ar thaifead an othair chun go mbeadh siad in ann cinneadh a dhéanamh, ar mhaithe leis an othar, féachaint an bhfuil an t-othar ag fulaingt ó neamhórd meabhrach
The report must be presented by the consultant psychiatrist to the tribunal and to the patient's legal representative, within 14 days
Caithfidh an tuairisc a bheith curtha i láthair ag an síciatrach comhairleach don bhinse agus do ionadaithe dlíthiúla an othair, taobh istigh de 14 lá
The mental health tribunal must review the detention of the patient and make a decision within 21 days of the making of the order
Caithfidh an binse meabhair-shláinte coinneáil an othair a athbhreithniú agus cinneadh a dhéanamh taobh istigh de 21 lá ó dhéanamh an ordú

If the tribunal is satisfied that the patient is suffering from a mental disorder and that the proper procedures have been followed (or, if they have not, the failure does not affect the substance of the order and does not cause an injustice), it affirms the order

Má tá an binse sásta go bhfuil an t-othar ag fulaingt ó neamhórd meabhrach agus gur leanadh na nósanna imeachta ceart (nó, mar a bhfuil, nach athraíonn an teipeadh substaint an ordaithe agus nach mbíonn aon éagóir ag baint leis), dearbhaíonn sé an t-ordú
If it is not satisfied, it revokes the order and directs that the patient be discharged
Muna bhfuil sé sásta déanann sé cúlghairim ar an ordú agus ordaíonn sé an t-othar a scaoileadh abhaile
In order to carry out its functions, the tribunal has similar powers to a court, including the power to require the attendance of the relevant people and the production of documents

Chun go mbeadh sé in ann na feidhmeanna seo a dhéanamh, tá na cumhachtaí céanna ag an mbinse agus atá ag an gcúirt, ina n-áiritear an chumhacht a éilíonn go bhfreastalaíonn na daoine cuí agus go gcuirfear cáipéisí ar fáil

The tribunal is, of course, obliged to respect the usual requirements of natural justice, for example, it must ensure that the patient has copies of the reports that are being considered by the tribunal

Tá oibligeáid ar an mbinse, ár ndóigh, ómós a bheith acu do ghnáth éilimh cearta nádúrtha, m.sh., caithfidh sé a chinntiú go mbeidh cóipeanna dena tuairiscí atá faoi chaibidil ag an mbinse, le fáil ag an othar
The tribunal must notify its decision, in writing, to:
Caithfidh an binse a chinneadh a chuir in iúl i scríbhinn, chuig:
• The psychiatrist responsible for the patient's care and treatment
• An síciatraí atá freagrach as cúram agus cóireáil an othair
• The patient and their legal representative
• An t-othar agus a c(h)uid ionadaithe dlíthiúla
• Any other person the tribunal considers should have notice
• Aon duine eile a cheapann an binse gur chóir fógra a fháil
The review tribunal must consist of a lawyer as chairman, a consultant psychiatrist and a person who is not a lawyer or doctor
Caithfidh dlídóir a bheith mar chathaoirleach an binse meabhair-shláinte , agus caithfidh go mbeidh síciatraí comhairleach agus duine nach dlídóir ná dochtúr é páirteach ann chomh maith
Members of the Commission may not serve on a tribunal
Ní féidir le baill an Choimisiúin freastal a dhéanamh ar an mbinse

A further function of the tribunals, under the direction of the Mental Health Commission, is to consider any request for authorisation from a consultant psychiatrist to perform psycho-surgery on a patient where the patient gives their consent in writing to such treatment

Ceann eile de fheidhmeanna na mbinsí, faoi stiúir An Choimisiún Meabhair-Shláinte, ná breithniú a dhéanamh ar aon éileamh ó shíciatraí comhairleach chun údarás a fháil le haghaidh sícemháinliacht a dhéanamh ar othar, nuair a thugann an t-othar a t(h)oil i scríbhinn i gcomhair an cinéal seo cóireála

If the tribunal is satisfied that such surgery is in the best interests of the person, it will authorise such surgery or where it is not so satisfied, refuse it. Where to apply Mental Health Commission St
Má tá an binse sásta go bhfuil an mháinliacht seo ar mhaithe le leas an duine, tabharfaidh sé údarás do leithid de mháinliacht, nó mura bhfuil sé sásta diúltóidh sé dó
